subject: Career
title: Finding and Cultivating Allies
description: A 60-second lesson on Finding and Cultivating Allies.

hook.text: Navigating office politics alone is like playing chess without pieces. You need allies.

buildup.text: Allies are people who support your goals, share your values, and will advocate for you.

discovery.text: The best allies aren't always in your department. Cross-functional allies provide different perspectives and reach.

twist.text: Alliances require maintenance. Neglect them and they dissolve when you need them most.

climax.text: Invest in allies before you need them: help with their goals, celebrate their wins, share information.

punchline.text: You can't build alliances during a crisis. Build them before.

quiz.question: Why are cross-functional allies valuable in office politics?
options: They provide different perspectives and reach across the organization
